detail.content: Choreography and Collaboration: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                              Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance        2. Choreography and Collaboration  Loading (Javascript must be enabled to view video) Students  have many opportunities to create choreographic works throughout the year, and  see them staged and lit in our dance theater. As well, there are wonderful opportunities to collaborate  with musicians, designers, and media artists. We feel if a  student desires to become a choreographer it is important to create many works,  and we offer the opportunity to do this with some of the best young performers  in the country. Choreography: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Choreography  OART-UT.805 Studio 2 Credits Instructor(s): Check Albert The purpose of this studio course is to enable the student to gain an appreciation and knowledge of dance creation through movement exploration and performance. We focus on the foundations of choreography through better understanding use of space, control, aesthetics, alignment, musicality, development of learning strategies within a duet/group context, as well as personal and artistic expression. Each student will make solos, duets, and collaborative group work as well as present their work to an audience at the end of the semester.  Check Albert for course schedule.  Required Courses (16 Points) Minor in Dance           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
